title: Is Harry Potter author J.K. Rowling a closeted trans person? - Quora

response.answer_text: Doubtful. But she sure isn’t who I thought she was, considering all of her recent buffoonish tweets and posts about trans people and their authenticity. Personally, I just don’t get why so many incredibly wealthy and successful people who have worked so hard for their position in pop culture— and all the recognition they’ve achieved—just suddenly go off on a sensitive topic they know is likely going to do them damage. Unbelievable. So now, instead of being known as the incredibly talented and imaginative mother of the Harry Potter world, she’s quickly earning the labels as a quack and a TERF. And that she’s doubling down on all of her ignorant twaddle just makes her look even more pathetic—and frankly, like she’s going nuts. She’s gonna be in BIG trouble with her fans in very short order (already is with some), if she can’t stifle her urge to hurt some very fragile people who don’t deserve to be her cultural victims. “Middle age rant.” My ass…

Nothing suggests that is the case so far, and I wish people would stop putting forth the idea that being phobic against homosexuals or transgender people means that said person is closeted themselves. Yes sure, this is the case for some people. But other people are just assholes, or ignorant, or any number of other things that does not corellate to being a closeted anything. Maybe JK Rowling is indeed a closeted transgender. But the bigger likelyhood is, she is not and she’s just someone who holds asshole opinions.
